caption: Students in Daniel Ritchie's lab created a data-driven generative model that can synthesize new virtual bedrooms and other types of 3D indoor scenes.
Students in Daniel Ritchie's lab trained a neural network to 'reverse engineer' CAD modeling sequences for 3D shapes.
Students in Jeff Huang's lab built a tool for freehand drawing using just your hands in augmented reality on phones.
Students in Daniel Ritchie's lab built a system for creating new 3D floor plans by automatically recombining rooms from existing floor plans.
Students in Daniel Ritchie's lab trained a neural network to write programs that generate structured 3D shapes, such as chairs.
Students in James Tompkin's lab trained a neural network to transmogrify images of animals without altering the image background.
Students in Jeff Huang's lab enable fine-grained interaction with virtual objects in augmented reality on phones.
Students in James Tompkin's lab trained a neural network to automatically recover control rigs for animals to generate new posable imagery.
Students in James Tompkin's lab created a neural generative model that can learn to write in your handwriting and represent all kinds of different styles.
Students and collaborators of Srinath Sridhar built a method to learn how humans move.
Students and collaborators of Srinath Sridhar built a method to build high-quality models of objects from only a few images.
Students and collaborators of Srinath Sridhar lab built a method for learning to reconstruct objects in a canonical space enabling robots to find and manipulate them.
Chen Sun and his students designed algorithms to illustrate sentences, anticipate future events, and learn visual commonsense, all by asking computers to watch videos on YouTube.
Chen Sun and his students build agents that follow human instructions and perform highly compositional tasks.
Students in Jeff Huang's lab build a tool for illustrations that applies dynamic filters to the ink.
